page.title: 14THE EVELEIGH ROOMS PURLEIGH
page.content: The{Eveleigh Rooms},are at the top of the hill opposite Purleigh Church. Originally it was a{school}.In1769 the{Rev. Horsmundon}left money to pay a schoolmaster. {The Rev. Eveleigh}had the school and house built in the early 1800's. In{1808}there were 10 boys and 10 girls. In 1915 the head master(Mr. Hathaway),and some of the boys moved the books and equipment down the hill, in wheelbarrows,to the new school. After many years as a meeting place and club room,it became unsafe. In early 1985 it was rescued by the Fraul family,who have turned it into a house.
